definitions: lacking in or hostile to culture, the arts, or intellectual pursuits
relating to the ancient people of Philistia in biblical Palestine
examples: His philistine attitude toward modern art annoyed the curator
The philistine critics dismissed the experimental film immediately
The philistine warriors fought against the Israelites in battle
Archaeological discoveries revealed philistine pottery and artifacts

definitions: intimate and affectionate but not involving sexual relations or physical desire
relating to the Greek philosopher Plato or his philosophical ideas
examples: Their relationship remained purely platonic despite years of friendship
She maintained platonic friendships with several male colleagues
The platonic ideal of justice influenced Western philosophical thought
His platonic philosophy emphasized the world of perfect forms

definitions: relating to Poland, its people, language, or culture
examples: The Polish government announced new economic reforms yesterday
She studied Polish history at the university
We enjoyed traditional Polish cuisine at the festival
The Polish community celebrates their heritage every year

definitions: relating to Portugal, its people, language, or culture
examples: Portuguese explorers discovered many new trade routes to Asia
She speaks fluent Portuguese after living in Lisbon
The Portuguese cuisine features excellent seafood and pastries
Portuguese colonial architecture can be seen throughout Brazil

definitions: relating to or belonging to any Christian church that separated from the Roman Catholic Church during the Reformation
examples: The Protestant churches emphasized individual faith and scripture reading
Protestant missionaries established schools throughout the region
The Protestant work ethic influenced American cultural development significantly
Several Protestant denominations merged to form larger congregations

definitions: relating to the Greek philosopher and mathematician Pythagoras or his mathematical and philosophical teachings
examples: The Pythagorean theorem remains fundamental to geometry and trigonometry
Pythagorean philosophy included beliefs about numbers and harmony
The Pythagorean school influenced later mathematical and philosophical thought
Students memorized the Pythagorean formula for calculating triangle sides

definitions: having changed one's behavior or habits to become better or more acceptable
relating to Protestant churches that follow Calvinist theological traditions
examples: The reformed criminal now counsels troubled youth in schools
His reformed lifestyle impressed everyone who knew him before
The Reformed Church maintains strong communities in several countries
Reformed theology emphasizes predestination and God's sovereignty

definitions: relating to the ancient city, republic, or empire of Rome and its civilization
relating to the modern city of Rome or the Roman Catholic Church
examples: Roman legions conquered vast territories across Europe and Africa
The Roman Empire lasted for over five hundred years
Roman architecture includes famous landmarks like the Colosseum
The Roman Catholic Church has its headquarters in Vatican City

definitions: relating to languages derived from Latin, including French, Spanish, Italian, Portuguese, and Romanian
examples: Romance languages share many grammatical features and vocabulary roots
She studied several Romance languages during her linguistics degree
The Romance language family spread throughout Europe and beyond
Romance language speakers can often understand related languages partially

definitions: relating to Romania, its people, language, or culture
examples: Romanian folklore includes fascinating stories about vampires and werewolves
The Romanian language is the only Romance language in Eastern Europe
Romanian gymnasts dominated international competitions for many years
Traditional Romanian cuisine features hearty stews and grilled meats

definitions: relating to Russia, its people, language, or culture
examples: Russian literature produced masterpieces by Tolstoy and Dostoevsky
The Russian winter defeated Napoleon's army in eighteen twelve
Russian ballet companies are renowned for their technical excellence
She's studying Russian to read the classics in their original language

definitions: relating to or characteristic of the Sahara Desert in North Africa
examples: Saharan dust storms can travel across the Atlantic Ocean
The Saharan climate is extremely hot and dry year-round
Saharan peoples have adapted to harsh desert living conditions
Sub-Saharan Africa refers to regions south of the desert

definitions: relating to or characteristic of Satan or devil worship
extremely evil, cruel, or wicked in nature or behavior
examples: The satanic cult performed rituals in the abandoned church
Medieval art often depicted satanic imagery to warn believers
His satanic cruelty shocked even hardened police investigators
The dictator's satanic plan caused immense human suffering

definitions: relating to Saudi Arabia, its people, or culture
examples: Saudi oil reserves are among the largest in the world
The Saudi government announced major economic reforms recently
Saudi Arabian culture blends Islamic traditions with modern development
Saudi businesses are investing heavily in renewable energy projects

definitions: relating to the Germanic people who conquered and settled in Britain in the fifth and sixth centuries
examples: Saxon warriors established kingdoms throughout England after Rome fell
The Saxon language influenced the development of modern English
Anglo-Saxon culture produced remarkable poetry and metalwork artifacts
Saxon churches were built with distinctive architectural features

definitions: relating to the countries of Scandinavia (Norway, Sweden, Denmark) or their peoples, languages, and cultures
examples: Scandinavian design emphasizes simplicity, functionality, and natural materials
The Scandinavian welfare model provides extensive social benefits
Scandinavian mythology includes tales of Thor, Odin, and Loki
Many Scandinavian companies lead in sustainable business practices

definitions: relating to Scotland, its people, or products, especially whisky
examples: Scotch whisky must be distilled and aged in Scotland
The Scotch pine is native to northern Europe
Traditional Scotch broth contains barley, vegetables, and lamb
Scotch tape was originally manufactured using adhesive from trees

definitions: relating to Scotland, its people, language, or culture
examples: Scottish independence has been debated for many centuries
The Scottish Highlands offer breathtaking scenery and ancient castles
Scottish traditions include Highland games and Burns Night celebrations
She learned to play traditional Scottish music on the bagpipes

definitions: relating to the ancient city of Babylon or the Babylonian Empire in Mesopotamia
examples: Babylonian mathematics included sophisticated astronomical calculations and predictions
The Babylonian captivity was a pivotal event in Jewish history
Babylonian culture produced the famous Code of Hammurabi laws
Ancient Babylonian texts were written in cuneiform on clay tablets

definitions: relating to the Baltic Sea or the countries bordering it, especially Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania
examples: Baltic states regained independence after the Soviet Union collapsed
The Baltic Sea connects several Northern European countries
Baltic amber has been traded for thousands of years
Baltic languages form a distinct branch of Indo-European languages

definitions: relating to the group of African peoples and languages spread across central, eastern, and southern Africa
examples: Bantu languages share common grammatical structures and vocabulary roots
The Bantu migration shaped the demographic landscape of Africa
Bantu peoples developed sophisticated iron-working techniques very early
Traditional Bantu music features complex polyrhythmic drumming patterns

definitions: relating to the highly ornate European artistic and architectural style of the seventeenth and eighteenth centuries
extremely elaborate, complex, or convoluted in style or character
examples: Baroque churches feature dramatic sculptures and gilded decorations
The baroque music of Bach showcases intricate counterpoint
His baroque explanation confused rather than clarified the issue
The novel's baroque plot involved multiple timelines and narrators

definitions: relating to statistical methods based on Bayes' theorem for calculating probability from prior knowledge and new evidence
examples: Bayesian statistics revolutionized machine learning and artificial intelligence
The Bayesian approach updates beliefs based on new data
Bayesian inference helps doctors diagnose diseases using test results
Many Bayesian models are used in financial risk assessment

definitions: relating to the Christian monastic order following the Rule of Saint Benedict
examples: Benedictine monks have maintained their traditions for fifteen centuries
The Benedictine abbey produces famous liqueurs and manuscripts
Benedictine spirituality emphasizes prayer, work, and community living
She joined a Benedictine convent after years of contemplation

definitions: relating to Bengal, Bangladesh, or the Bengali people and their language
examples: Bengali cuisine features fish, rice, and elaborate sweet desserts
The Bengali language is spoken by millions in Bangladesh and India
Bengali literature includes works by Nobel laureate Rabindranath Tagore
Traditional Bengali music combines classical and folk elements beautifully

definitions: being a member of any people speaking a Semitic language, including Arabs and Jews
examples: Semite peoples share linguistic and cultural heritage from ancient times
The term Semite derives from Shem, Noah's son
Both Semite and non-Semite populations inhabited the ancient region
Ancient Semite traders established routes throughout the Mediterranean

definitions: relating to the peoples who speak Semitic languages or their cultures, including Hebrew, Arabic, and Aramaic speakers
examples: Semitic languages share similar grammatical structures and root systems
The Semitic alphabet influenced many modern writing systems
Ancient Semitic religions shaped the development of monotheism
Semitic studies examine the languages and cultures of these peoples

definitions: relating to Senegal, its people, languages, or culture in West Africa
examples: Senegalese music has influenced genres worldwide, especially through mbalax
The Senegalese economy depends heavily on fishing and agriculture
Senegalese cuisine features dishes like thieboudienne and yassa
Many Senegalese artists have gained international recognition recently

definitions: relating to Serbia, its people, language, or culture in southeastern Europe
examples: Serbian Orthodox churches feature distinctive Byzantine architectural elements
The Serbian language uses both Cyrillic and Latin alphabets
Serbian history includes centuries of Ottoman and Austrian rule
Traditional Serbian music features the accordion and trumpet prominently

definitions: relating to or characteristic of William Shakespeare, his plays, poetry, or dramatic style
examples: Shakespearean tragedies explore universal themes of power and ambition
The Shakespearean sonnet follows a specific fourteen-line structure
Her Shakespearean performance as Lady Macbeth earned critical acclaim
Shakespearean language enriched English with hundreds of new words

definitions: relating to the indigenous Japanese religion focusing on ritual practices and shrine worship
examples: Shinto shrines are marked by distinctive torii gates
The Shinto religion emphasizes purity and harmony with nature
Shinto priests perform rituals for various life events and seasons
Many Japanese practice both Shinto and Buddhist traditions simultaneously

definitions: relating to the former kingdom of Siam, now Thailand, or its people
describing twins who are physically connected at birth
examples: Siamese cats originated from the royal palaces of Thailand
The Siamese kingdom maintained independence during colonial times
The famous Siamese twins Chang and Eng toured the world
Siamese twin separation surgery requires careful medical planning

definitions: relating to Siberia, the vast region in northern Asia, or its harsh climate and conditions
examples: Siberian winters are among the coldest on Earth
The Siberian tiger is the largest living cat species
Siberian indigenous peoples have unique cultural traditions and languages
Trans-Siberian railway connects Moscow with the Russian Far East

definitions: relating to Sicily, the largest Mediterranean island, its people, dialect, or culture
examples: Sicilian cuisine combines Italian, Greek, and Arab influences
The Sicilian Mafia originated from nineteenth-century protection rackets
Sicilian dialect differs significantly from standard Italian language
Ancient Sicilian temples showcase Greek architectural magnificence

definitions: relating to the monotheistic religion founded in Punjab by Guru Nanak or its adherents
examples: Sikh temples, called gurdwaras, welcome people of all faiths
The Sikh turban is worn as a symbol of faith and honor
Sikh teachings emphasize equality, service, and honest living
Many Sikh festivals celebrate the lives of the ten Gurus

definitions: relating to Singapore, its people, or the unique multicultural society of this city-state
examples: Singaporean food courts offer Chinese, Malay, and Indian cuisines
The Singaporean economy transformed from port to financial hub
Singaporean English, or Singlish, blends multiple language influences
Many Singaporean policies focus on maintaining racial harmony

definitions: being a member of the Slavic peoples of Eastern Europe
examples: Slav peoples migrated across Eastern Europe in early medieval times
The ancient Slav communities developed unique agricultural practices
Both Slav and Germanic tribes inhabited Central European regions
Early Slav settlements have been discovered by archaeologists

definitions: relating to the Slavs or their languages, including Russian, Polish, Czech, and Serbian
examples: Slavic languages share common grammatical features and vocabulary
The Slavic peoples spread across Eastern Europe during medieval times
Slavic mythology includes tales of Baba Yaga and firebirds
Many Slavic cultures celebrate similar traditional festivals

definitions: relating to the Slavs, their languages, or Old Church Slavonic used in religious texts
examples: Slavonic manuscripts preserved ancient religious and historical texts
Old Church Slavonic served as a liturgical language for centuries
Slavonic studies programs examine the languages and cultures comprehensively
The Slavonic alphabet was created by Saints Cyril and Methodius

definitions: relating to Slovakia, its people, language, or culture in Central Europe
examples: Slovakian mountains offer excellent skiing and hiking opportunities
The Slovakian language is closely related to Czech
Slovakian folk traditions include colorful costumes and lively dances
Many Slovakian castles date back to medieval times

definitions: relating to Slovenia, its people, language, or culture in southeastern Europe
examples: Slovenian caves include the famous Postojna Cave system
The Slovenian language has preserved dual grammatical number
Slovenian wine regions produce excellent white wines
Traditional Slovenian cuisine features hearty stews and dumplings

definitions: relating to Socrates or his method of teaching through systematic questioning to expose contradictions
examples: The Socratic method encourages critical thinking through guided questions
Her Socratic approach helped students discover answers themselves
Socratic dialogue remains influential in philosophy and education today
Law schools often employ Socratic questioning in classroom discussions

definitions: demonstrating or characterized by great wisdom in judgment, especially in difficult disputes, like King Solomon
examples: The judge's Solomonic decision satisfied both parties in dispute
Her Solomonic wisdom helped resolve the family conflict peacefully
The mediator proposed a Solomonic solution to the boundary dispute
His Solomonic judgment earned respect from all stakeholders involved

definitions: relating to Somalia, its people, language, or culture in the Horn of Africa
examples: Somali poetry has a rich oral tradition spanning centuries
The Somali language uses a Latin-based alphabet since nineteen seventy-two
Somali cuisine features flatbread, rice, and spiced meat dishes
Traditional Somali culture emphasizes clan identity and oral history

definitions: relating to the former Soviet Union, its political system, or the period of its existence from 1922 to 1991
examples: Soviet space program achieved many pioneering accomplishments in exploration
The Soviet economy operated under central planning principles
Soviet architecture featured monumental buildings and worker housing blocks
Many Soviet republics gained independence in nineteen ninety-one

definitions: relating to Spain, its people, language, or the Spanish-speaking world
examples: Spanish conquistadors explored and colonized much of the Americas
The Spanish language is spoken by over 500 million people
Spanish cuisine includes paella, tapas, and excellent wines
Spanish art flourished during the Golden Age of painting

definitions: marked by strict self-discipline, simplicity, and avoidance of luxury or comfort
relating to ancient Sparta or its militaristic culture
examples: His spartan lifestyle included only basic furniture and necessities
The military training camp maintained spartan living conditions
Spartan warriors trained from childhood for military service
The Spartan society valued discipline and courage above all

definitions: relating to Joseph Stalin's totalitarian policies and methods of government in the Soviet Union
examples: Stalinist purges eliminated millions of perceived enemies
The Stalinist era saw rapid industrialization at terrible human cost
Stalinist architecture featured imposing neoclassical buildings and monuments
Many Stalinist policies were denounced after Stalin's death

definitions: enduring pain or hardship without showing feelings or complaining
relating to the ancient Greek and Roman philosophy emphasizing virtue and emotional control
examples: She remained stoic throughout the painful medical procedure
His stoic acceptance of misfortune impressed everyone around him
Stoic philosophers taught that virtue is the highest good
The Stoic philosophy influenced many later ethical systems

definitions: relating to Sudan, its people, languages, or culture in northeastern Africa
examples: Sudanese Arabic is the most widely spoken language in Sudan
The Sudanese pyramids at Meroë predate many Egyptian pyramids
Sudanese culture blends Arab and African traditions uniquely
Traditional Sudanese music features distinctive drumming patterns
